paper_abstract: The Local Hamiltonian problem is the problem of estimating the least eigenvalue of a local Hamiltonian, and is complete for the class QMA. The 1D problem on a chain of qubits has heuristics which work well, while the 13-state qudit case has been shown to be QMA-complete. We show that this problem remains QMA-complete when the dimensionality of the qudits is brought down to 8.
paper_title: THE LOCAL HAMILTONIAN PROBLEM ON A LINE WITH EIGHT STATES IS QMA-COMPLETE
